intro: Ilex brassii, commonly known as the African holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy dark green leaves. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. Ilex brassii typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in warm climates.
